First, the variables:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>

int main() {

    char time1[6], time2[6];

    fgets(time1, 6, stdin); // read first time, like "09:30\n"

    fgets(time2, 6, stdin); // read second time.

    // parse first time:

    int h1, m1;

    sscanf(time1, "%d:%d", &h1, &m1);

    int total1 = h1 *60 + m1;

    // parse second time:

    int h2, m2;

    sscanf(time2, "%d:%d", &h2, &m2);

    int total2 = h2 *60 + m2;

    // compute difference:

    int difference = (total1 - total2) % 1440;

    // handle negative mod:

    if (difference <0) difference +=1440;

    // or difference = (total1 - total2 + 1440) %1440;

    // better to compute as:

    difference = (total1 - total2 + 1440) % 1440;

    // format into time_diff_str:

    int hours = difference /60;

    int mins = difference %60;

    char time_diff_str[6];

    sprintf(time_diff_str, "%02d:%02d", hours, mins);

    // Now process this string through the second part's logic.

    int num_g =0, num_p=0;

    int score =0;

    for (int i=0; time_diff_str[i] != '\0'; i++) {

        char c = time_diff_str[i];

        if (c == 'g') {

            if (num_g - num_p >0) {

                score +=1;

                num_p +=1;

            } else {

                num_g +=1;

            }

        } else if (c == 'p') {

            if (num_g - num_p >0) {

                num_p +=1;

            } else {

                score -=1;

                num_g +=1;

            }

        }

        // else: do nothing

    }

    printf("%d\n", score);

    return 0;

}
